title: Beautiful italic serif
content:
OK, I should know this one, and am gonna kick myself when someone finally enlightens me... but I can't remember the name of this font. Is it an italic Garamond?, a version of Foundry Wilson? What??! It seems to be doing the rounds at the moment and is popping up everywhere...

thanks,  
K

comments.content: Love the use of fluorescent ink, too -- very '90s Emigre.

Sorry Mark, it’s not.  
It’s [Adobe Caslon Bold Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150405011247/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/adobe_caslon_pro_bold_italic/), with swashes turned on. [Came up before](http://web.archive.org/web/20150405011247/http:/typophile.com/node/47746).

Well-spotted, Florian!

I spoke too soon, but perhaps provided a useful alternate.

Still stand by my affection for the fluorescent ink. :)

<cite>perhaps provided a useful alternate.</cite>

Absolutely! :-)  
And the best thing for all the cheapskates among us: One of them comes [bundled with Adobe CS](http://web.archive.org/web/20150405011247/http:/blogs.adobe.com/typblography/2008/09/cs4_fonts.html), the other [with Mac OSX](http://web.archive.org/web/20150405011247/http:/support.apple.com/kb/HT1642) (at least the Italic & Black Italic – albeit in the unwieldy dfont format).
